image.altText: A cricketer wearing official whites.

props.synopsis: It's been 15 years since Jake Weatherald moved south to pursue his dream of becoming a professional cricketer, but it was the return to Darwin that served as one of his life's defining moments.

title.children: Darwin-born professional cricketer shines in home-game debut

image.altText: A woman in a t-shirt stands in front of a quick-flowing river in the remote Northern Territory.

props.synopsis: Scientists say one of the Northern Territory's most important water systems is experiencing "significant depletion".

title.children: NT's vast Cambrian Limestone Aquifer 'getting drier', research finds

image.altText: Two SES workers wearing orange uniforms, searching through a grassy landscape.

props.synopsis: The search for missing Alice Springs man Gach Top has been suspended after five days, after police and the SES sought local advice from trail guides and family friends.

title.children: Police suspend search for missing 26yo man Gach Top in Red Centre

image.altText: An Indigenous man shaking hands with the prime minister.

props.synopsis: NT Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro was not in attendance at the 25th Garma festival after pushing tough-on-crime rhetoric as the prime minister claims "the cheap politics of division" would not lead to solutions.

title.children: Albanese urges NT to draw on Indigenous knowledge rather than playing politics

image.altText: An aerial view of a wharf part of the Darwin Port, with the city of Darwin in the distance.

props.synopsis: A worker is in hospital after an object fell and crushed his pelvis in a workplace accident at an East Arm site in Darwin.Â

title.children: Worker's pelvis crushed by falling object in industrial accident

image.altText: A woman with cropped dark curly hair stands leaning against a bright pink mural.

props.synopsis: When it comes to suicide prevention, Samantha McIntosh knows more than most, and senior lecturer Dr Anton Isaacs believes her lived experience is essential to turning the tide in Australia's mental health space.

title.children: Meet the woman pushing to turn suicide prevention on its head

image.altText: A close-up shot of a politician speaking to media.

props.synopsis: After politicising the stabbing of a 15-year-old boy at the Darwin Show, the Northern Territory government has battened down the hatches with its rhetoric. The subtext: You're either with us, or against us.

title.children: 'Gutter trash': A government hell-bent on change tears down its critics

image.altText: An old image of a young police man in khaki uniform, smiling with a police hat on

props.synopsis: An expert in trauma and suicide has told a coronial inquest into the death of a veteran officer that better mental health checks within the police force would likely have flagged him as an "officer at risk".

title.children: PTSD expert urges NT police to prioritise mental health screening

image.altText: Old picture of Peter Falconio (left) at his graduation with girlfriend Joanne Lees (right)

props.synopsis: Bradley John Murdoch's death is not enough to quash the goal of finding Peter Falconioâs remains and delivering answers to his family, a cold case forensics expert says.

image.altText: A doctor wraps a tape measure around a child's skeletal arm. The circumference is in the "red" category for acute malnutrition.

props.synopsis: Doctors and aid workers say the world's concern over the aid blockade in Gaza has come too late. Many of the children you've read about probably can't be saved.Â

title.children: The red part of this tape represents a point from which children can't return

image.altText: Compilation of photos of men posing for camera with prominent photo of Richard Fidler in suit

props.synopsis: As a child, Richard Fidler was endlessly curious. That same thirst for understanding has guided him behind the Conversations mic, gently drawing captivating stories from his guests.

title.children: What Richard Fidler has learnt from others about happiness

image.altText: A search and rescue aircraft.

props.synopsis: A search is underway for a light aircraft missing over Bass Strait since Saturday, bound for Central Western New South Wales, with the Spirit of Tasmania joining the search effort.

title.children: Search underway for aircraft missing over Bass Strait with two onboard

image.altText: Jye is wearing a bright yellow t-shirt and is jumping off the jetty onto the sand.

props.synopsis: Sand surrounds the jetty in the small beachside community of Port Gregory on WA's Mid West coast and locals are calling on the government to intervene.

title.children: People once fished off this jetty. Now there's nothing but sand

image.altText: A curator at the Australian War Memorial displaying the old bottle of beer.

props.synopsis: When best mates Stanley Lewis and Frederick Hume enlisted to serve in World War II, a publican in the NSW town of Wingham gave them a gift they would never be able enjoy together.

title.children: Two mates made a pact about this bottle of beer. Itâs still unopened

image.altText: Image shows an elderly Japanese woman standing in front of a stove in a kitchen

props.synopsis: In Japan, you can rent a grandmother to help cook for you and give you support. What do services like this mean for Japanâs aging population, especially for women?Â

title.children: Elderly women in Japan are keeping themselves employed as grandmas-for-hire

image.altText: Close-up of part of a grey and white air purifier.

props.synopsis: Even air purifiers with the best filters vary in how well they clear your home of smoke. Here's what to look for in a unit, and how to make the most of it.

title.children: Wood smoke can harm your health. Can an air purifier protect you?

image.altText: Here's Leonardo Puglisi setting up to anchor the 6 News Sunday night bulletin.

props.synopsis: Australian teenagers have grown up on YouTube and admit it can be harmful, but some say the government's blanket ban will do little to address the problems.Â

title.children: Australian teens reflect on losing YouTube, a gen Z cultural fixture

image.altText: A woman in a black long-sleeved surf rashie with a blue boogie board under her arm at the beach.

props.synopsis: From Granny Grommets shredding waves on the Gold Coast to Fitzroy Fossils rowing their way into retirement, these ageing Aussies prove it's never too late to start fitness and fun.

title.children: Secret to ageing well for these Aussies is 'wearing out' not 'rusting out'

image.altText: A video still of Tom Gleeson behind a podium. The ABC lissajous in the top left corner and the Hard Quiz logo in the top right

props.synopsis: Back again, I see. Haven't you been humiliated enough?

title.children: Five quick hits: Lightning causes havoc, Nic is white hot, and Max stuns again

image.altText: A newborn baby is shown lying down, with one of its feet in the foreground of the image.

props.synopsis: The Queensland coroner describes the case of a baby â known to child safety authorities â who starved to death while his mother and her partner were on a drug binge as "utterly tragic".

title.children: Eight-month-old baby dies while mother and partner on drug binge

image.altText: Young woman with hair down wearing patterned blazer, sitting in well-lit room.

props.synopsis: Lies are circulating on social media, AI chatbots are being manipulated. Hannah Ferguson and Nobel Peace Prize winner Maria Ressa reflect on the dangers of disinformation, and why it can lead to real-world violence.Â

title.children: How social media is amplifying hate and fracturing social cohesion

image.altText: Two people embrace

props.synopsis: After a lacklustre start to the 2025 season, the Melbourne Vixens upset minor premiers West Coast Fever in the Super Netball grand final, 59-58.

title.children: Fairytale finish for Vixens coach after mid-season resignation

title.children: Pallister claims silver in 'race of the century' at world champs

image.altText: A close up of a man's face as he stands in front of a bush

props.synopsis: Together, a new body horror starring Alison Brie and Dave Franco, ignited a bidding war at this year's Sundance Film Festival. Now the world is finally being let in to Australian director Michael Shanks's sticky nightmare.

title.children: Australian director went to US to get noticed, sells film for $26m

props.synopsis: Australians Minjee Lee and Steph Kyriacou make some nice moves at the Women's British Open as they head into the final day.

title.children: Lee and Kyriacou make strong moves at the Women's British Open

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns as he looks off camera while Xi Jinping stands behind him.

props.synopsis: The Trump administration quietly reversed a policy that tightened restrictions on microchip exports to China, but why the sudden backflip?Â

title.children: Has Trump just given China a leg-up in the AI arms race?

image.altText: Three ambulances lined up in a row outside a hospital.

props.synopsis: Western Australia may have to shift its focus to making ambulance ramping safer until the health system is able to meet growing demand, writes state political reporter Keane Bourke.Â

title.children: Amid record ambulance ramping, WA faces a wicked problem

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera seated in a garden

props.synopsis: For most people, a package delivered to their homes is usually welcomed but for people experiencing domestic violence, alcohol delivery is "like the guided missile that is the match".

title.children: Former Neighbours star urges changes to alcohol delivery laws

image.altText: Photos of a lantern and memorabilia on a wall

props.synopsis: After three decades, Broome's Son Ming Chinese restaurant has closed its doors because of a kitchen fire. Locals are worried the town's unique heritage is being slowly eroded.

title.children: Restaurant fire sparks end of an era for Broome's Chinese community

image.altText: Composite image Jeremy Rockliff and Dean Winter.

props.synopsis: While the Liberals and Labor play their power games, Tasmania's parliament is paused; no legislation is being passed and the state is effectively left on standby â with the make-up the same as before the election.

title.children: Vote counting done, the deal-making begins for Tasmania's next government

image.altText: A man sits in front of a bright blue car covered in advertisements.

props.synopsis: In the 80s, racing car Tru Blu was rebuilt thanks to crowdfunding. Now history has repeated to build a cherished replica.

title.children: Town rallies to help man build his dream car after cancer diagnosis

image.altText: Oscar Piastri celebrates victory, standing on his car, helmet still on, raising his arms in the air

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri is chasing a seventh grand prix win in 2025, and a second consecutive Hungarian Grand Prix triumph. Here is what you need to know about the Hungarian Grand Prix.Â

title.children: F1 Hungarian Grand Prix: How to watch, what time does it start?

image.altText: Jessica Cottis in the midst of conducting an orchestra, dressed in all black with her hair tied back in a ponytail.

props.synopsis: Musicians share their experience of what it's like living with synaesthesia, including how they manage this wonderful, sometimes overwhelming multi-sensory experience.

title.children: For people with synaesthesia, music can evoke more than goosebumps
